sources.title: Missouri Department of Labor and Industrial Relations

nonCompete.lawReference: Missouri common law - House Springs v. Schneider
nonCompete.detailedExplanation: Missouri courts are very employer-friendly regarding non-competes. Statewide geographic scope often upheld. 2 years typically reasonable. Blue-pencil doctrine applies.
nonCompete.suggestion: Non-competes strongly enforceable - use reasonable 2-year limit
nonCompete.alternativeLanguage: non-compete restrictions (enforceable in Missouri with reasonable duration)

minimumWage.detailedExplanation: Minimum wage increases annually through 2026. January 1, 2025: $13.75/hour. January 1, 2026: $15.00/hour.

paidLeave.message: EARNED PAID SICK TIME REQUIRED (effective May 1, 2025)
paidLeave.detailedExplanation: Employers with 15+ employees must provide earned paid sick time. 1 hour per 30 hours worked. Can accrue up to 56 hours per year (15+ employees) or 40 hours (fewer than 15 employees).
paidLeave.requirement: Provide 1 hour per 30 hours worked (effective May 1, 2025)
paidLeave.actionRequired: Implement earned sick time policy by May 1, 2025
paidLeave.source: Missouri Prop A - Earned Sick Time

finalPay.message: Final wages due immediately if terminated, next payday if quit
finalPay.detailedExplanation: Involuntary termination: immediately. Voluntary resignation: next regular payday.
finalPay.actionRequired: Ensure capability for immediate final payment

rightToWork.message: Missouri is RIGHT TO WORK state
